Drinking water so as not to get dehydrated, doing some form of exercise for fitness.Having diabetes can cause loss of sensations due to nerve damage.  A HbA1c blood test would show the glucose levels over a 2-3 month period and would confirm if you have diabetes or not.Make an appointment with your doctor to get your blood checked for any hormonal imbalance as well as the problems mentioned by Caryopteris.  If you are low in testosterone, the doctor will prescribe a testosterone gel.  The gel comes in measured doses in individual sachets that you would rub on your arm or leg.Best wishes.
